org.openhubframework.openhub.admin.web.common.rpc

Class ChangeableRpc<T extends Identifiable<ID>,ID extends Serializable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openhubframework.openhub.admin.web.common.rpc.BaseRpc<T,ID>
      • org.openhubframework.openhub.admin.web.common.rpc.ChangeableRpc<T,ID>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Identifiable<ID>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DbConfigurationParamRpc, NodeRpc

    public abstract class ChangeableRpc<T extends Identifiable<ID>,ID extends Serializable>
extends BaseRpc<T,ID>
    RPC that can be created or updated. BaseRpc is for readonly RPCs.

    There is the following lifecycle when entity is created from RPC - calling createEntity() or createEntity(BindingResult) or createEntity(BindingResult, Map):

    1. validates attributes and state of the RPC - validate(BindingResult, Identifiable)
    2. creates new entity instance - createEntityInstance(Map)
    3. updates attributes - updateAttributes(Identifiable, boolean), where second parameter is true

    There is the following lifecycle when entity is updated from RPC - calling updateEntity(Identifiable) or updateEntity(Identifiable, BindingResult):
    1. validates attributes and state of the RPC - validate(BindingResult, Identifiable)
    2. updates attributes - updateAttributes(Identifiable, boolean), where second parameter is false

    Since:
    2.0
    Author:
    Petr Juza

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        protected abstract void validate(org.springframework.validation.BindingResult errors,
                                 @Nullable
                                 T updateEntity)
                          throws ValidationException
        Validates RPC (mandatory attributes, correct object state etc.).

        There are the following possibilities how to make validation:

        • add errors to errors (e.g. use ValidationUtils). If it has errors then InputValidationException will be thrown
        • throw ValidationException itself (e.g. use Constraints for asserts)
        • if exception is thrown and it's not type of ValidationException then original exception will be wrapped by IllegalDataException
        • use JSR-303 Bean Validation API
        Parameters:
        errors - Binding/validation errors
        updateEntity - null if new entity is created otherwise entity that is updated
        Throws:
        ValidationException - when there is error in input data
